availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John F. Baker (Caldwell co., ky, farmer, pvt and 4th serg. 4th ky inf CSA)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Carney Baker in Trigg County, Kentucky, on April 9, 1840. Father of Letitia L. Baker, Sarah E. Baker, Telitha Alice Baker, and Wiley Baker. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Long Pond in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A) as a private, fourth sergeant, and third sergeant from August 18, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 322A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 12.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 76.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 174.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0096.
